name: TheAtlantic
text: "The most productive way to think about Biden’s selection of Buttigieg, as well as other secretaries, is as a whole: What kind of Cabinet is the president-elect trying to assemble?" asks @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/9V3OjRI79o

name: TheAtlantic
text: Tom Cruise shouted at crew members on the set of "Mission: Impossible 7" for failing to follow safety protocols. The incident exposed the widening power imbalance in Hollywood, @shirklesxp writes: https://t.co/iWLXHvz9DP

name: TheAtlantic
text: “In Yang’s pages,” @BarbaraDemick writes, “Mao is a demented emperor, cackling madly at his own handiwork as rival militias—each claiming to be the faithful executors of Mao’s will, all largely pawns in the Beijing power struggle—slaughter one another.” https://t.co/4nDK8Fk2oD

name: TheAtlantic
text: A 107-foot World War II–era tugboat has been abandoned in Alaskan waters for nearly a decade. Getting rid of it is easier said than done, @vgpetersen reports. https://t.co/A2XkSeFzC2

name: TheAtlantic
text: Books on Jesus by Colm Tóibín, Mary Rakow, and @arielsabar in this week's #TheAtlanticBooksBriefing. From @marystachyra: https://t.co/rX55EmfO4h

name: TheAtlantic
text: Many Americans are spending the final days of 2020 without the comfort of loved ones. Below are some ideas for helping navigate this lonely period. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/363Ary2QBy

name: TheAtlantic
text: Go ahead, take one: An ode to naps. https://t.co/RsGMr5dLMq

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Settling on a show that ran for seven full seasons (or 40) eased decision fatigue and guaranteed at least a few weeks of blissful simplicity." Hannah Giorgis on the appeal of watching 'The Sopranos,' 'Survivor,' and other time-consuming TV shows in 2020: https://t.co/jheCbXcpmi

name: TheAtlantic
text: Listen to @IsaacDovere talk with @WhipClyburn about the transition, Biden's cabinet, and the Democratic party in 2021. https://t.co/cGorqGjEyS

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The odds are we never should have been born. / Not one of us." A poem by @doriannelaux: https://t.co/KYOnl4ZJoy

name: TheAtlantic
text: A boom in Congo's shark-fishing industry is evaporating, writes @ManRambling, threatening the livelihood of fisherman and their families. https://t.co/onfPXP5KzB

name: TheAtlantic
text: A boom in Congo's shark-fishing industry is evaporating, writes @ManRambling, threatening the livelihood of fishermen and their families. https://t.co/27uF2MGoxT

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Within 48 hours of the first people in the U.S. receiving the Pfizer vaccine," @noUpside writes, "anti-vaccine activists were amplifying stories of allergic reactions and sharing claims about friends of friends whom the vaccine had supposedly injured." https://t.co/c7MZwfPswe

name: TheAtlantic
text: Readers respond to recent stories in @theatlantic magazine: https://t.co/6o0QhtvmdT

name: TheAtlantic
text: Suffrage “decanted into public life a large number of women who had thought rigorously about injustice as both an individual and a systemic matter,” @DeborahACohen writes. “They were prepared to meet the obstacles in their way and forge on.” https://t.co/G1dtoFgyOO

name: TheAtlantic
text: "In the year we have spent standing up the nation’s newest service, space has grown more crowded, more contested, and more vital to our economy and national security," General John W. Raymond writes: https://t.co/ChYnviK0ox

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Given Trump’s psychological profile, it was inevitable that when he felt the walls of reality close in on him ... he would detach himself even further from reality," writes @Peter_Wehner: https://t.co/13sii9VMOH

name: TheAtlantic
text: "A president who yearned to use the military to overthrow an election remains by far the most popular figure—and most potent fundraiser—in one of the country’s two great parties," writes @DavidFrum: https://t.co/SYOsgr72M1

name: TheAtlantic
text: The joys and vulnerabilities of a Black childhood, as seen from a father’s gaze, by @EnaAlvarado: https://t.co/juh20GkFsb
